meanings.definition: To make accustomed or used to something
meanings.sent1: She habituates herself to waking up early by setting multiple alarms.
meanings.sent2: The puppy quickly habituated to its new home and family.
meanings.sent3: After a while, he habituated to the sound of the train passing by his window every morning.
meanings.sent4: The city noise habituated her ears to constant background chatter.
meanings.sent5: Repeated exposure to spicy food habituated his taste buds to the heat.

meanings.definition: To adapt or become accustomed to a particular situation or environment
meanings.sent1: The plants slowly habituate to the sunny spot in the garden.
meanings.sent2: Over time, she habituated to the fast-paced rhythm of the city.
meanings.sent3: The students habituate to the routine of their daily classes.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes habituated to the dim lighting in the underground cave.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's body habituated to the intense training regimen.
